manifest.title: Invidious
manifest.author: Invidious team
manifest.description:
## About

An open source alternative front-end to YouTube

## Features

* Lightweight
* No ads
* No tracking
* No JavaScript required
* Light/Dark themes
* Customizable homepage
* Subscriptions independent from Google
* Notifications for all subscribed channels
* Audio-only mode (with background play on mobile)
* Support for Reddit comments
* Available in many languages, thanks to our translators
* Import subscriptions from YouTube, NewPipe and Freetube
* Import watch history from YouTube and NewPipe
* Export subscriptions to NewPipe and Freetube
* Import/Export Invidious user data
manifest.postInstallMessage:
This app is pre-setup with an admin account. The initial credentials are: **Username**: admin
**Password**: changeme
If it stops showing and playing videos you should delete `/app/data/.youtube-trusted-session-generator` file and restart the app.
manifest.changelog:
* Update invidious to v2.20260207.0
* [Full Changelog](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/releases/tag/v2.20260207.0)
* Livestream experiences are restored: Trending shows livestreams again, the gaming feed remains accessible, and "Watch on YouTube" links stop carrying stale timestamps ([#5480](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5480), [#5555](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5555), [#5481](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5481))
* Channel and playlist metadata is richer thanks to pronoun support, topic playlist thumbnails, and accurate related video counts ([#5617](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5617), [#5616](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5616), [#5446](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5446))
* Downloads get smoother because download actions are URL-safe and downloads can flow through Invidious companion when available ([#5367](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5367), [#5561](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5561))
* Users see clearer feedback with Erroneous CAPTCHA messages, DMCA controls restored, and a footer link pointing at the current release ([#5508](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5508), [#5228](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5228), [#4702](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/4702))
* Companion integration is sturdier: CSP is generated once, check identifiers persist, and the helper hyperlink is fixed ([#5497](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5497), [#5575](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5575), [#5491](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5491))
* Proxied images and videoplayback strip unwanted response headers (shared header-strip list) ([#5595](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5595))
* Runtime and packaging updates pin docker/OCI builds to Crystal 1.16.3, bring an optional Crystal 1.18.2 + Alpine 3.23 image, and compile OpenSSL from source to mitigate the memory leak seen with Alpine-provided OpenSSL ([#5604](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5604), [#5577](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5577), [#5574](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5574), [#5441](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5441))
* Server stability improves via a larger `max_request_line_size` that is required to be able to access some next pages of Youtube channels videos and a rewritten static file handler ([#5566](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5566), [#5338](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5338))
* Top-level constants moved into dedicated modules, preferences handling was cleaned up, and the legacy signature helper is finally removed ([#5596](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5596), [#5450](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5450), [#5550](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5550))
* Crystal API updates replaced the deprecated `Socket#blocking` property and restored the shard target plus SPDX license metadata ([#5538](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5538), [#5608](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5608), [#5552](https://github.com/iv-org/invidious/issues/5552))
